org.cicirello.matrixops

Class MatrixMultiplier

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cicirello.matrixops.MatrixMultiplier

    public class MatrixMultiplier
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of matrix multiplication.

    8.15.2017
    Author:
    Vincent A. Cicirello

        public MatrixMultiplier()

    • Method Detail

      • multiply

        public double[][] multiply(double[][] a,
                           double[][] b)
        For matrices a and b, compute a * b. The number of columns of a must be equal to the number of rows of b. This method assumes dimensions of a and b are consistent for a legal multiplication, and may throw a bounds exception if they are not.
        Parameters:
        a - First matrix
        b - Second matrix
        Returns:
        a * b

      • multiply

        public double[][] multiply(double[][] a,
                           double[][] b,
                           boolean bIsTransposed)
        For matrices a and b, computes either a * b, or a * transpose(b). The number of columns of a must be equal to the number of rows of b (if b is not transposed) or the number of columns of b (if b is transposed). This method assumes dimensions of a and b are consistent for a legal multiplication, and may throw a bounds exception if they are not.
        Parameters:
        a - First matrix
        b - Second matrix
        bIsTransposed - If true, then b is actually the transpose of b.
        Returns:
        a * b

      • transpose

        public final double[][] transpose(double[][] m)
        Computes the transpose of a matrix m.
        Parameters:
        m - The matrix
        Returns:
        transpose of m
